page.title: 14Tourism
page.content: The Cotswold Farm Park is open to the visitors from Easter until the end of September each year. It was started by Mr. and Mrs. J. Henson in 1970 as a centre for the preservation of rare breeds of animals. Since then alecture hall,coffee shop and souvenir shop have been built and it now receives thousands of visitors each year. It employs many people on a seasonable basis as well as about 5 fulltime farmworkers. Tourists ae also catered for by 4 places offering Bed and Breakfast accomodation and food can be obtained at the Halfway House Pub at Kineton. Many coach companies provide touring holidays which pass through the area and many people also come on walking or cycling holidays.
